summary: This document is the second amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust. It details changes to the trust, including the distribution of $20 million to another trust and the removal of a bequest to Jeffrey A. Schantz. The amendment was executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein and notarized.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the Grantor of the trust and is making amendments to it.

persons.name: Jeffrey A. Schantz
persons.context: Jeffrey A. Schantz was previously mentioned as a beneficiary in the trust but is being removed from the bequest.

persons.name: Lauren J. Kwintner
persons.context: Lauren J. Kwintner notarized the amendment to the trust.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein was previously the benefactor to Jeffrey A. Schantz through the trust, but this relationship is being altered by the amendment.
Lauren J. Kwintner acted as the notary public for the trust amendment executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein.

events.title: Second Amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust
events.description: The second amendment to the trust was executed, changing the distribution of funds and removing a beneficiary.

keyFacts: The trust was amended to distribute $20 million to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two.
The bequest to Jeffrey A. Schantz was removed from the trust.
The amendment was executed on December 3, 2004, by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Lauren J. Kwintner served as the notary public for the amendment.
The document is marked as confidential.
